text.section: An applicant for a license may apply to the clerk only at the office of the clerk during regular office hours.

The Social Security numbers of the parties:
shall be included in the electronic file for the marriage license application; and
except as provided in § 10-617 of the State Government Article, may not be disclosed as part of the public record of the marriage license application.

If the parties to be married are not residents of the county where the marriage ceremony is to be performed, the clerk shall accept, instead of the application specified in subsection (b) of this section, an affidavit from 1 of the parties to be married. The affidavit shall:
contain the information required by subsection (b) of this section; and
be sworn to under oath before a clerk or other comparable official in the county, state, province, or country where the party resides.
In Cecil County both parties to be married shall appear together before the clerk to apply for a license.
Until a license becomes effective, a clerk may not disclose the fact that an application for a license has been made except to the parent or guardian of a party to be married.
